submission:
class Solution:
    def maximumValueSum(self, board: List[List[int]]) -> int:
        row, col = len(board), len(board[0])
        p = []
        for i in range(row):
            for j in range(col):
                p.append([board[i][j], i, j])
        p.sort(reverse = True)
        # print(p)
        limit = len(p)
        ans = float("-inf")
        for i in range(len(p)):
            rseen = set()
            cseen = set()
            rseen.add(p[i][1])
            cseen.add(p[i][2])
            for j in range(i+1, len(p)):
                if j >= limit:
                    break
                if p[j][1] in  rseen or p[j][2] in cseen:
                    continue
                rseen.add(p[j][1])
                cseen.add(p[j][2])
                for k in range(j+1, len(p)):
                    if p[i][0] + p[j][0] + p[k][0] < ans:
                        break
                    if p[k][1] in rseen or p[k][2] in cseen:
                        continue
                    rseen.add(p[k][1])
                    cseen.add(p[k][2])
                    ans = max(ans, p[i][0] + p[j][0] + p[k][0])
                    limit = min(limit, k)
                    rseen.remove(p[k][1])
                    cseen.remove(p[k][2])
                    break
                rseen.remove(p[j][1])
                cseen.remove(p[j][2])
        return ans
